Sentencas: This study introduces a novel hybrid methodology for model identification of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks by integrating a radial basis function-based artificial neural network (RBF-ANN) with a flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimizer (FA-BERO).
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The primary objective of the proposed method is to augment the precision and efficiency of SOFC stack modeling by considering the advantages of both RBF-ANN and FA-BERO algorithms.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The main purpose of using these two methods is to optimize the structure of the RBF-ANN based on the suggested FA-BERO algorithm.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The other contribution of this study is improving the efficiency of the Al-Biruni Earth radius optimizer (A-BERO) by applying two improvements on it, including constriction factor and elimination phase to increase the exploration and exploitation strength of the basic A-BERO.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: To validate the effectiveness of the proposed model, it is compared with some state-of-the-art models in the field, such as the artificial neural network and multi-armed bandit algorithm (ANN/MABA) and rotor Hopfield neural network and grey wolf optimization (RHNN/GWO).
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: Furthermore, the model is validated by experimental data, and the final results demonstrate the efficacy of the hybrid approach in accurately representing the intricate behavior of SOFC stacks.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The proposed model achieves lower error rates (ERs) and root mean squared errors (RMSEs) than the comparative methods across different network arrangements and temperature conditions.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The results show that, for instance, for the 2/12/1 network arrangement at 900 degrees C, the proposed model attains an ER of 6.69% and an RMSE of 2.13, while the ANN/MABA and RHNN/GWO methods obtain ERs of 9.67% and 8.54%, as well as RMSE values of 24.48 and 9.23, respectively.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: The proposed model also exhibits superior accuracy and convergence speed compared to the comparative methods, as shown by the current-voltage curves and the convergence analysis.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach

Sentencas: Consequently, this novel hybrid methodology offers a valuable tool for researchers and engineers working in the domain of fuel cell technology, enabling them to better understand and optimize SOFC stack performance.
Titulo: SOFC stack modeling: a hybrid RBF-ANN and flexible Al-Biruni Earth radius optimization approach
